overview:
Eric Tsai is an entrepreneur, the founder and chief executive officer of eriQoo.com, an online search engine of rating and recommendation.

Prior to founding eriQoo.com in 2006, Eric Tsai was a Fixed Income Trader at Credit Suisse (formerly Credit Suisse First Boston) where he was the youngest Analyst.

Eric Tsai was voted Number 1 by BusinessWeek as the best entrepreneur, and the 2010 Chinese CEO of the year. He delivers speeches regarding entrepreneurships frequently including 3 speeches at Harvard Business Conference, 1 at Peking University (Beijing University), and at 2011 Global Competitiveness Forum where he shares stage with Former President Bill Clinton and Former Prime Minister Tony Blair.

As a Taiwan native, Eric Tsai studied abroad in the US for his high school, and moved to Japan for college. Eric Tsai still resides in Japan, where he has donated $30 million USD for the 2011 North-Eastern Japan Earthquake relief.

Eric Tsai is also an investor overseeing a private equity fund of $1 billion USD asset under management, focus geographically on Greater Asia region.

Eric Tsai is a quarto-lingual speaker to English, Japanese, Chinese and Taiwanese, he graduated Sophia University in Tokyo Japan with a degree of Business Management.
